title: Police investigate after teen was shot in North Toledo
content:
Toledo police are investigating an incident in which a teenage boy was shot at his North Toledo residence.
Police said LaMount Coates, 15, of Toledo, was admitted to Mercy Health St. Vincent Medical Center, where a hospital spokesman said she had no information about a person by that name. Lt. Joe Heffernan, police spokesman, said young Coates was shot “in the neck area” but the injury did not appear to be life-threatening.
The teen was playing video games in an upstairs bedroom at a house in the 1700 block of Locust Street about 7:15 p.m. Monday, when someone fired several shots into the residence, police said in a written statement released today. One of the bullets struck the victim.
Lieutenant Heffernan said police had no motive. There were no suspects, according to the report.
The incident is being investigated as a felonious assault.
There have been 168 people shot this year in the city, according to a Blade review of police reports.
